item.title: Choosing a Running Shoe
item.description: Five big factors to consider: Terrain Cushioning Gait Support Size Mileage Terrain Road-running shoes are generally light, flexible and even cushioning with flatter and smoother soles. Trail-running shoes have bigger lugs to grip on unstable terrain, stronger underfoot and generally stiffer to handle uneven surfaces. Cross-training shoes are thiner and simpler, to be used indoors for workouts and balance activities. Cushioning The two main aspects are firmness and thickness of the foam between your feet and the ground.
